snippet: The police moved to arrest unlicensed currency dealers and increase patrols in Tehran to prevent unofficial trading from disrupting new official exchange rates for Iran’s currency, the rial.
abstract: Iranian police officers move to arrest unlicensed currency dealers and increase patrols in Tehran to prevent unofficial trading from disrupting new government-imposed rates of exchange for rial, national currency.

byline.contributor: Ramtin Rastin contributed reporting from Tehran, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: The police moved to arrest unlicensed currency dealers and increase patrols in Tehran to prevent unofficial trading from disrupting new official exchange rates for Iran’s currency, the rial.

headline.seo: Iran Places New Restrictions on Currency Trading
headline.main: Strict New Procedures for Iran Currency Trading After Protest
headline.print_headline: Iran Places New Curbs On Trading Of Currency
